meanings.definition: To strike (one's toe) accidentally against a hard object.
meanings.sent1: I stubbed my toe on the table.
meanings.sent2: She stubbed her toe on the door frame.
meanings.sent3: He stubbed his toe so often, he started wearing slippers everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The pain of stubbing my toe felt like a lightning bolt shooting through my foot.
meanings.sent5: The memory of stubbing my toe still makes me cringe.

meanings.definition: To extinguish (a cigarette or cigar) by pressing the burning end against a solid object.
meanings.sent1: He stubbed out his cigarette in the ashtray.
meanings.sent2: She always stubs out her cigar before leaving the room.
meanings.sent3: The detective stubbed out his cigarette as he pondered the case.
meanings.sent4: The end of the cigarette was stubbed out like a tiny firecracker.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the stubbed-out cigar lingered in the room.

meanings.sent1: The tree had a stubbed trunk.
meanings.sent2: Her fingers were stubbed and strong from years of hard work.
meanings.sent3: The stubbed pencil was too short to use.
meanings.sent4: The stubbed legs of the table made it sturdy and reliable.
meanings.sent5: The stubbed appearance of the rock gave it a unique charm.
